tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE public_transportation_usage (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    route_id INT,
    travel_date DATE,
    start_station VARCHAR,
    end_station VARCHAR,
    fare DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE public_transportation_users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    user_name VARCHAR(50),
    user_age INT,
    user_email VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE transportation_routes (
    route_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    route_name VARCHAR(50),
    route_type VARCHAR(20),
    start_location VARCHAR(100),
    end_location VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE route_usage_stats (
    usage_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    route_id UUID REFERENCES transportation_routes(route_id),
    user_id UUID REFERENCES public_transportation_users(user_id),
    usage_date DATE,
    number_of_trips INT
)

CREATE TABLE public_transport_stops (
    stop_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    stop_name STRING,
    stop_location STRING,
    total_passengers INT
)

CREATE TABLE public_transport_routes (
    route_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    route_name STRING,
    route_description STRING,
    frequency INT
)

CREATE TABLE passenger_records (
    record_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    passenger_id UUID,
    route_id UUID,
    stop_id UUID,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE route_statistics (
    route_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    total_passenger_count INT,
    average_frequency FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE Trips (
    trip_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    route_id INT REFERENCES Routes(route_id),
    user_id INT REFERENCES Users(user_id),
    fare DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    trip_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Tickets (
    ticket_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    trip_id INT REFERENCES Trips(trip_id),
    user_id INT REFERENCES Users(user_id),
    ticket_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    ticket_price DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL
);
